title: System sorting incoming mail
content:
I am using Thunderbird as my email handler. I have (at the moment) two email addresses. One with SFR and one with Cegetel, both are French providers.

Almost every incoming message to my SFR address is instantly dropped into the Deleted box. Knowing this to be incorrect sorting 99% of the time I always look in the Deleted box to see if it is a genuine message that I want to read. Although this isn't the end of the world, I still get to see the message. What is worrying me is that when I open the Deleted box to see the contents they disappear. They are deleted from the box before I can make the final decision.

Is there any way I can stop Thunderbird from doing this "pre-filtering" or at least stop it deleting the contents of the Deleted box?

title: Thunderbird - correction orthographique
content: Bonjour, Depuis quelque temps, le correcteur orthographique de Thunderbird ne fonctionne plus correctement : - la vérification pendant la saisie est inopérante ; - lors d'une vérification provoquée (Options/Vérifier l'orthographe) ou avant envoi du message, les fautes sont bien trouvées, mais la correction accole le "bon" mot au "mauvais", alors qu'il devrait s'y substituer. Exemple : "Je suis le propriétaireproopriétaire de la maisonmmaison" corrigeant "Je suis le proopriétaire de la mmaison". Mes paramétrages semblent corrects : Rédaction/ Vérifier avant envoi et Vérification pendant la saisie cochés et Langue Français. Est-ce que ce phénomène est connu et existe-t-il une solution ? Par avance merci. Salutations.

title: Using Thunderbird on a Mac -- clash with text replacements
content:
1. Using Thunderbird (143.0.1) on a Mac (Sequoia 15.7) that has text replacements doesn't work. Mac text replacements ordinarily are filled In when the space bar is pressed, but in Thunderbird the replacements are filled in regardless, so, for instance, I have the text replacement "tr" -- when I press those letters followed by a space it ordinarily expands to the word "there". In Thunderbird every time I type those two letters, even if they are followed by other letters, it expands.

So if I type "trunk" It looks good until I hit a space, when it expands to "thereunk". This happens whether I type the word or use speech input (Talon). I use a lot of text replacements for common words, so this happens frequently, making it unusable.

I'm a longtime Thunderbird user just now switching to a Mac. I'm hoping for a fix so I can use text replacements in Thunderbird, but a short term workaround would be the ability to turn text replacements off through the edit\substitutions menu (like other programs including Notes).

Thanks for listening. And thanks for doing all the good work — it’s a terrific program!
creator: Kim113

title: How to recover lost cryptocurrency—and how to keep it safe
content: I never imagined I would fall victim to a scam. After months of researching online trading, I stumbled across what seemed to be a professional brokerage firm. Their platform looked polished, their representatives spoke with confidence, and at first, small withdrawals went through without issues. This gave me false reassurance, Encouraged, I gradually invested more until I had over $77,000 worth of Bitcoin tied up with them. That’s when things went wrong. Suddenly, my withdrawal requests were pending indefinitely. Support became evasive, asking me to pay extra fees, taxes, and even insurance deposits. Deep down, I knew I had been deceived. The realization was devastating. That was my savings, money I had worked years to build. Sleepless nights followed. I searched for solutions online, but most recovery services I found looked just as suspicious as the brokers who scammed me. Then, I came across Swift Recovery Services. What caught my attention was not just their professionalism but also their transparency. Unlike others, they didn’t make unrealistic promises. Instead, they explained how blockchain tracing, transaction analysis, and direct negotiations could help track stolen crypto. From the first consultation, I felt I was in safe hands. They asked for every detail transaction IDs, wallet addresses, email trails, and communication logs with the fake brokers. Their team went to work immediately, combining legal expertise with advanced crypto forensics. Within weeks, there was progress, Finally, after weeks of waiting that felt like months, I received the notification I thought I’d never see my $77,000 worth of Bitcoin was recovered. The relief was indescribable. Thanks to Swift Recovery Services, I not only reclaimed my stolen funds but also regained peace of mind. title: Explain: "To Recover Disk Space, Old Messages Can Be Permanently Deleted"
content:
Please explain this option in Account Settings > Synchronization & Storage > Disk Space:

"To recover disk space, old messages can be permanently deleted, both local copies and originals on the remote server." [Then, there are options to allow you to decide how far back you want to save messages from deletion.]

First, I do see that this is not a global setting but is able to be set differently for each email account within Thunderbird, which is great. But it doesn't say whether these deleted messages will draw from EVERY folder or just the TRASH. I need the ability to apply this option to solely the TRASH folder, like "Delete messages older than 90 days," for example. There are messages in the Inbox that I need to save for a year or more, including emailed tickets or travel info, for example.

Look forward to your explanation!

title: STARTLS Error Message When Attempting to Send Message from  Gmail Account
content:
Over a month ago I began experiencing an error message when attempting to send emails from my gmail account using Thunderbird (TB). Error msg reads: Sending of the message failed. For more information go to: https://support.google.com/a/answer/3221692 and review RFC 3207 specifications. 00721157ae682-765bb916a90sm38332507b3.4-gsmtp. Please verify that your email address is correct in your account settings and try again.***While I have looked at all of this, I can't really find a solution I know how to implement.***

I can send emails using Google webmail and when I do, the emails show up in my TB Sent items folder. I'm totally stumped and considering moving to Outlook. But TB has been perfect for me for years and I want to stay with it. Any help will be much appreciated!

title: Thunderbird 143.0.1 deleting local folders
content:
I just posted this on Reddit as well, here is my Reddit message. thanks!!

=======

Very weird situation. I'm a professor, and have used Thunderbird for like ~15 years, and generally love it. I have 1000s of messages archived in local folders, which I have been doing forever.

I was using Thunderbird 143.0.1, on a reliable Windows 11 system. Yesterday I noticed about ~50 folders just randomly missing, and panicked thinking maybe my hard drive was corrupt. My subsequent troubleshooting was:

[a] I fortunately made a Paragon Hard Drive Backup from earlier in September, and restored it. That backup was using Thunderbird 142.0. All of ~50 folders were back to life!!! (minus messages that I archived over the last month, of course).

[b] Thunderbird then did an un-solicited auto-update back to 143.0.1. Now the same ~50 folders are gone again !?! WTF.

[c] I did another Paragon Restore back to the same early September time point, but unplugged my ethernet cable. Then I started again, and turned Thunderbird Auto Updates to "off", keeping me at 142.0.

[d] Now everything is fine, Thunderbird works, and my folders are intact.

Conclusion: at least on my computer, Thunderbird 143.0.1 is bad and deletes a massive number of my important work folders. It doesn't look like they were archived, just completely lost. For now, I will keep "auto updates" off., and only consider updating after I do future Paragon backups. I will also maybe transition to IMAP folder storage. (I've been doing local folder storage for the last ~15 years).
creator: marcxanderson
